articles.title: BT to cut 55000 jobs with up to a fifth replaced by AI - BBC
articles.description: The telecoms giant plans to shed up to 40% of its workforce by the end of the decade to cut costs.
articles.content:
Telecoms giant BT is to shed up to 55,000 jobs by the end of the decade, mostly in the UK, as it cuts costs.
Up to a fifth of those cuts will come in customer services as staff are replaced by techn… [+3724 chars]

articles.title: U.K. government won't buy Virgin Orbit - SpaceNews
articles.description: The British government, which helped buy OneWeb out of bankruptcy three years ago, has no plans to do the same with launch company Virgin Orbit.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON The British government, which helped buy OneWeb out of bankruptcy three years ago, has no plans to do the same with launch company Virgin Orbit, a government minister said May 17.
